Today we'll get the opportunity to talk about how can we progress on the path of peace," said PM to Putin in Uzbekistan. This is their first meeting since the Ukraine war began.

175.title: Nadiadwala's film on 'Mahabharat' to release in 20 languages: Report
175.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala's upcoming film on 'Mahabharat' will reportedly be released in 20 languages. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, it will release in 15 international languages, including English, Thai, Mandarin, Russian, Japanese, African, Arabic, Korean, Cantonese and Malaysian among others. The film will reportedly also release in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada.

176.title: Blue light from phones may lead to earlier onset of puberty: Study
176.article_body: As per research, blue light from phones and tablets may lead to earlier onset of puberty in children. Melatonin is a hormone that helps control the sleep cycle and is associated with delaying the start of puberty in children. Its levels drop naturally as children grow up. But the blue light suppresses the level of melatonin, resulting in early puberty.

177.title: Restaurant's Muslim manager arrested for preserving raw cow meat in Surat
177.article_body: A Muslim manager of a restaurant, Delhi Dastarkhwan, in Surat was arrested for allegedly preserving raw cow meat in the restaurant's freezer. However, the accused, Sarfaraz Khan, claimed it to be buffalo meat. Meanwhile, the Forensic Science Laboratory's report mentioned that out of the six samples, two samples were cow meat while others were buffalo meat, police said.

178.title: 2 arrested from Haryana's Hisar for GST fraud of around ₹75 cr
178.article_body: Police arrested two people from Haryana's Hisar for allegedly evading goods and services tax of about ₹75 crore. The accused, Shubham and Deepanshu, were involved in creating fake firms and invoices, a police spokesperson said. "Police...recovered PAN cards, Aadhar Cards...two laptops, mobile phones, note-counting machine, blank cheques and a hard disk from the...accused," the spokesperson added.

179.title: Will beautify Delhi if get control of MCD: CM Arvind Kejriwal
179.article_body: Accusing the current MCD of trying to turn Delhi into a city of "garbage mountains", CM Arvind Kejriwal said if AAP gets control of the MCD, it'll beautify the national capital. "The government is working to make Delhi a City of Tirangas, lakes and parks and these people want to turn it into a city of garbage mountains," he added.

180.title: PM Modi true follower of BR Ambedkar: Former President Kovind
180.article_body: Former President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday said PM Narendra Modi is a true follower of BR Ambedkar and is working towards turning the social reformer's vision into reality. "As Babasaheb had said we are Indians first, Indians later and Indians till the end, PM Modi also says India first," Kovind said. PM Modi is vindicating Babasaheb's vision, he added.

181.title: We know your concerns on Ukraine war, want it to end soon: Putin to PM Modi
181.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday told PM Narendra Modi that Russia knew about India's stand and "concerns" on the conflict in Ukraine. "We want all of this to end as soon as possible," Putin told PM Modi on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan. "We'll keep you abreast of what's happening there," said Putin.

182.title: I save screenshots of posts that make personal attacks: Dulquer
182.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said in an interview that he saves screenshots of social media posts that make personal attacks. "If you search...my phone, you'll find screenshots of comments that personally attack me. I...even look at them from time to time," Dulquer said, adding, "Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, (I save them all). I remember the IDs of all those who attack me."

183.title: Reply to PIL on reduced hours in govt schools: HC to Delhi govt
183.article_body: The High Court has asked the Delhi government to respond to Public Interest Litigation (PIL) which alleged government schools in the city's northeast were conducting classes either on alternate days or for reduced hours. The pleas said classes were being held irregularly due to a lack of infrastructure. The court asked the government to respond in three weeks.

184.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan raided by ACB in Waqf board corruption case
184.article_body: The Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) on Friday raided AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's house and five other locations linked to him in a two-year-old corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board. As per reports, an unlicensed weapon and cash worth ₹12 lakh were seized from an aide of the MLA. Khan was called for questioning on Friday at 12 pm.

185.title: Irfan Pathan names his India playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022
185.article_body: Ex-Team India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has named his Team India playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022, which will begin in Australia next month. Irfan named Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul as his openers. Other players in the playing XI include Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik, Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jasprit Bumrah and Yuzvendra Chahal

186.title: Who is invited and who is not to Queen Elizabeth's funeral?
186.article_body: Japan's Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako will come for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral. Dutch King Willem-Alexander, King Philippe of Belgium, King Harald V of Norway will also attend. Among global leaders, US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron will attend the funeral. Russia and Belarus will be excluded, along with Myanmar and North Korea, said reports.

187.title: Clean buses & maintain punctuality: PMPML passengers in survey
187.article_body: Dirty buses, non-maintenance of punctuality and dilapidated bus stops are the main criticisms the Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has received in a survey it conducted among 2 lakh passengers. Among the replies, 69,252 were positive, 861 were negative and 55,454 made suggestions. The suggestions included restarting the ₹70-bus passes and launching a PMPML application.

188.title: Delhi records 8th monkeypox case as Nigerian woman tests positive
188.article_body: A 30-year-old Nigerian woman has tested positive for monkeypox in Delhi, becoming the city's eighth case of the disease and the 13th case across India. The woman is currently admitted to Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital. Monkeypox is a zoonotic viral disease which causes symptoms such as skin lesions, headache, fever, muscle aches and sore throat.

189.title: 50-yr-old man sodomises 12-yr-old UP boy, tries to kill him; arrested
189.article_body: A 50-year-old man has been arrested for sodomising a 12-year-old boy in a village in Uttar Pradesh. The boy was reportedly playing outside his house when Brahma Nand persuaded him to accompany him to a nearby field. After sodomising him, Nand tried to kill the boy by tying a rope around his neck. However, the boy managed to escape.

190.title: Harassment by loan apps rose 376% after pandemic: Pune Police
190.article_body: Complaints of harassment against persons running instant loan applications have increased by 376% after the COVID-19 pandemic, stated Pune Police's Cyber Cell. In 2019, police received 322 such complaints. The number rose to 837 complaints in 2020, then 928 in 2021 and 3,151 in 2022. Cyber cell Inspector Kumar Ghadge said these applications do not follow regular banking procedures.

191.title: Gang that sold cooking gas for commercial purposes busted in Mumbai
191.article_body: The Mumbai Police have busted a gang that used to convert LPG cylinders meant for household use under government subsidies, into commercial cylinders, by registering as fake consumers with gas agencies. The police arrested three accused, Trimuthi Tirumal (35), Mangilal Bisnoi (32) and Shravan Bisnoi (35), from a godown in Malwani and recovered 194 LPG cylinders.

192.title: Babar would've gotten lot of support if Malik was in Pak's T20 WC team: Afridi
192.article_body: Following Shoaib Malik's exclusion from Pakistan's 15-member squad for next month's T20 World Cup 2022, Shahid Afridi said the all-rounder deserves to be part of the squad. "He is a top choice for every franchise...[Captain] Babar Azam would have gotten a lot of support if Malik had been there, even if he was on the bench," he added.

193.title: Who is Pinky Irani, the woman who put Sukesh Chandrasekhar in touch with actors, models?
193.article_body: Pinky Irani, who was questioned in the money laundering case involving Sukesh Chandrasekhar, has been described as a "personal shopper" for actresses, including Jacqueline Fernandez. According to police, she was an anchor and is "well-connected" in entertainment industry. She'd allegedly ask actors and models to meet Sukesh or talk to him, and buy expensive gifts for them from his money.

194.title: Chinese officials banned from viewing Queen Elizabeth's coffin in UK: Reports
194.article_body: Chinese government officials who will visit the UK for Queen Elizabeth's funeral have been banned from viewing the late monarch as she lies-in-state at Westminster Hall, reports said on Friday. The delegation has been blocked from the vigil over sanctions imposed on British parliamentarians for criticising alleged human rights violations in Xinjiang. Five British MPs were sanctioned by Beijing.

195.title: No way to repay what SRK has done on Brahmastra: Ayan Mukerji
195.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji in an interview said, "There is no way to ever repay what Shah Rukh Khan has done on Brahmastra." "Unanimously, one of the favourite things in Brahmastra has been Shah Rukh sir's sequence," he added. Shah Rukh played the role of scientist Mohan Bhargav in the film.

196.title: Fatal road crashes in Delhi rose by 3.6% in 2021: Report
196.article_body: Fatal road crashes in Delhi went up by 3.6% in 2021 as compared to 2020, whereas total crashes rose by 13%, as per a report released by Delhi Police. The national capital witnessed 4,720 road crashes in 2021 in which 1,239 people lost their lives, the report added. Around 40.7% of the total persons killed in road crashes were pedestrians.

197.title: Mumbai man arrested for killing wife, dumping her headless body in creek
197.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Mumbai's Nalasopara has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and dumping her headless body in creek last year in Palghar. This year on August 29, the woman's grandmother approached police stating the woman had been missing for a year. Upon investigation, police found that her husband, who was suspicious of her character, had killed her.

198.title: US chess player accused of using sex toy to win against Magnus Carlsen, denies claims
198.article_body: A 19-year-old grandmaster has been accused of cheating to win a September 4 match against World Number one chess player Magnus Carlsen. American Hans Niemann denied online allegations that he used anal beads (a type of sex toy) that would vibrate and tell him about the best moves. "If they want me to strip naked, I'll do it," said Niemann.

199.title: TDP MLAs protest near Speaker's chair, suspended from Andhra Assembly
199.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker Tammineni Seetharam suspended 13 Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MLAs from the Assembly on Friday. The MLAs, who had surrounded Seetharam's chair and raised slogans, were evicted from the House by marshals. They wanted a discussion on rising prices by adjourning other items on the agenda. Notably, 16 TDP MLAs were suspended from the Assembly on Thursday.

200.title: Fertiliser crisis in Bihar artificial: Union Minister Bhagwanth Khuba
200.article_body: Union Minister of State for Chemicals and Fertilisers Bhagwanth Khuba accused the Nitish Kumar government of creating an artificial fertiliser crisis in Bihar despite adequate supply from the central government. "I urge...farmers not to pay even a penny extra, as the Narendra Modi government is giving heavy subsidies on urea, DAP, NPK, etc for the benefit of farmers," Khuba added.

201.title: My relations with Congress are almost zero: Veteran leader Karan Singh
201.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Karan Singh showed disappointment towards party functionaries and said that his relations with the grand old party are almost zero. Sharing that he was dropped from the working committee, he said, "Yes, I'm in Congress but there's no contact, nobody asks me anything. I do my own work. My relations with the party are almost zero now."

202.title: 51-yr-old Mumbai civic official loses ₹81,500 online while seeking refund
202.article_body: A 51-year-old civic official from Mumbai was cheated of ₹81,500 in a cyber fraud while trying to receive a refund after returning the headphones he had purchased online. According to police, a person claiming to be an executive from the e-shopping portal asked the complainant to download a remote access app on his phone and siphoned ₹81,500 from his account.

203.title: At least 8 killed as flash floods hit central Italy
203.article_body: At least eight people have been killed by torrential overnight rains and floods in Italy's Marche region, authorities said. Around 400 millimetres of rain fell within two to three hours, inundating the streets of several towns around the region's capital Ancona. "We were given a normal alert for rain, but nobody had expected anything like this," an official said.

204.title: Jadeja would have added more value in India's T20 WC squad: Prasad
204.article_body: Talking about India's squad for upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad said it's a balanced squad. "It has amazing batters and all-rounders. Ravindra Jadeja has missed out but would have added more value. Bowling looks very good. There are a lot of variations," he added. Jadeja was ruled out of the squad after undergoing knee surgery.

205.title: CBI team reaches Goa to investigate Sonali Phogat death case
205.article_body: A CBI team from Delhi has reached Goa to investigate the alleged murder case of actor Sonali Phogat. The Home Ministry had referred the case to the CBI after Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant wrote to the Union Home Minister Amit Shah, requesting a probe by the CBI. Police has so far arrested five people in connection with the case.

206.title: CSB Bank’s stock hits 6-month high after appointing Pralay Mondal as CEO & MD
206.article_body: A day after CSB Bank Limited announced the appointment of Pralay Mondal as the Managing Director and CEO, shares of the Kerala-based private lender hit a six-month high on Friday. At 2:20 pm, its shares were trading at a 2.55% high of ₹235.05 apiece on the NSE. Mondal has been appointed for a period of three years following RBI's approval.

207.title: Jharkhand CM meets Governor, asks for clarity on EC’s disqualification opinion
207.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren met Governor Ramesh Bais and demanded a copy of the recommendation sent by Election Commission in the office of profit case. He also urged him to clear the confusion prevailing in the state over his continuation as an MLA. He alleged that the BJP is trying to destabilise his government by talking about the case.

208.title: Patanjali will launch 4 IPOs in next 5 years: Baba Ramdev
208.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev announced the initial public offering plans for four Patanjali Group companies over next five years. The companies expected to be listed on the stock market are Patanjali Ayurved, Patanjali Wellness, Patanjali Medicine and Patanjali Lifestyle. He also said that "the action plan" is "to achieve the target of ₹5 lakh crore market value in coming years".

209.title: Harsha Engineers IPO subscribed 74.6 times on 3rd and final day
209.article_body: The initial public offering of Harsha Engineers International was subscribed 74.6 times with bids for 125 crore equity shares against the offer size of 1.68 crore shares on Friday, the final day of bidding. Non-institutional investors subscribed 71.3 times, followed by retail investors subscribing 17.5 times the portion set aside for them. Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 178.26 times.

210.title: Gaganyaan, ISRO's 1st human space mission delayed due to COVID: Govt
210.article_body: Gaganyaan, India's first-ever human spaceflight mission by ISRO, scheduled to be launched in 2022, has been delayed due to COVID-19 pandemic, said Jitendra Singh, the Minister of State (Independent Charge) Science and Technology.  "COVID-19 pandemic had a toll on the training of astronauts in Russia as well as India," he said. The mission is anticipated to be launched by 2024.

211.title: Minor girl abducted by 2 men, sedated & gang-raped in Hyd; accused held
211.article_body: Two men have been arrested by Hyderabad's Dabeerpura Police after they allegedly kidnapped, sedated and gang-raped a 14-year-old girl at a hotel. "The...[accused] were arrested and a car was recovered from their possession, they have been remanded to judicial custody," ACP Prasad Rao said. The arrests were made after the girl's mother filed a complaint with the police.

212.title: Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan report ‘heavy weapon’ use in border clash
212.article_body: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan on Friday accused each other of deploying heavy weaponry like mortars and tanks in an escalating conflict over a disputed mountainous frontier area that broke out two days ago. At least three people have been reportedly killed in the conflict so far. Leaders of both countries are currently attending a regional security summit in Uzbekistan.

213.title: Hansal uses Arbaaz's pic as he shares post on Federer's retirement, Twitter users react
213.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta shared a post after Roger Federer announced his retirement. He shared Arbaaz Khan's photo and wrote, "Going to miss you champion. #RogerFederer." "Best tweet on Federer's retirement," a Twitter user commented while another joked, "Hopefully you won't miss Federer's acting." Previously, social media users had pointed out resemblances in the appearance of Federer and Arbaaz.

214.title: 5-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians appoint Mark Boucher as head coach
214.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians (MI) have appointed former South Africa wicketkeeper Mark Boucher as their head coach. Boucher, who has been South Africa's head coach since 2019, will quit the national role after the T20 World Cup 2022. Earlier, MI promoted Mahela Jayawardene and Zaheer Khan to global roles in the franchise.

215.title: India A squad for one-day series against New Zealand A announced, Samson named captain
215.article_body: The BCCI on Friday announced the India A squad for the upcoming one-day series against New Zealand A. Sanju Samson has been named captain of the squad. The squad includes Prithvi Shaw, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Rahul Tripathi, Kuldeep Yadav, Rahul Chahar, Shardul Thakur and Umran Malik. The three-match series will begin on September 22.

216.title: Samantha to play princess, Ayushmann a vampire in a horror-comedy: Reports
216.article_body: Actors Ayushmann Khurrana and Samantha Ruth Prabhu have reportedly teamed up for a horror-comedy film. According to reports, Samantha will play the role of a princess while Ayushmann will star as a vampire in the upcoming film, which will be backed by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films, the production house behind films like 'Stree', 'Roohi' and the upcoming 'Bhediya'.

217.title: India undoing ecological wrong by bringing back cheetahs: Union Minister
217.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Friday said India is one of those countries that believe in undoing ecological wrongs. "Cheetahs became extinct in India due to overhunting. We have decided to bring the large carnivore back. This ecological wrong is being undone," Yadav added. Notably, eight cheetahs from Namibia will be introduced in India on September 17.

218.title: 90,000 people treated in 1 day for water-borne diseases in flood-hit Pak
218.article_body: Tens of thousands of people are suffering from infectious and water-borne diseases in flood-hit Pakistan, government data showed. More than 90,000 people were treated on Thursday in the Sindh province alone, one of the areas worst affected by flooding. The unprecedented floods have killed 1,508 people, including 536 children, in Pakistan, the country's National Disaster Management Authority said.

219.title: Kerala HC stays transfer of judge over 'sexually provocative dress' remark
219.article_body: Kerala HC stayed the transfer of Kozhikode sessions judge who had made "sexually provocative dress" remark. The judge had made the remark while granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case. He had said that the offence under Section 354A of IPC is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses".

220.title: Vijay is aggressive; Prabhas, Jr NTR are humble: RGV on 'Liger' failure
220.article_body: Speaking about the failure of 'Liger', filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said that actor Vijay Deverakonda is "naturally aggressive" but the film flopped due to Karan Johar's association with it. "Another factor...is humility...The down-to-earth nature of [Jr NTR, Ram Charan and Prabhas] impressed the Hindi audience...Then Vijay came along with his natural aggressive speeches at 'Liger' events," he added.

221.title: Blackmailed using video, 14-yr-old girl raped by many at Gurugram spa
221.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly raped by several men at a Gurugram spa where she got a receptionist's job. She said that on her first day at the job, the spa operator forced her into a room where a man raped her. She alleged the operator blackmailed her using the incident's video, after which she was raped on multiple occasions.

222.title: 5 held in Thane for cheating e-commerce websites of ₹5.85 lakh
222.article_body: The Thane Police arrested five persons, including an MTech engineer and a call centre employee, for allegedly cheating Amazon and Flipkart of ₹5.85 lakh by submitting fake Aadhaar card details. The accused cheated the e-commerce retailers by placing orders for electronic gadgets and later returning the parcels filled with sand and old clothes instead of the actual products, police said.

223.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father hospitalised after complaining of uneasiness
223.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has been admitted to a hospital in Punjab's Patiala. Balkaur Singh had complained of uneasiness on Thursday night following which he was admitted to the hospital. Member of Parliament Preneet Kaur and former Aam Aadmi Party leader Dharamvir Gandhi visited him at the hospital.

224.title: Interstate drug peddler held in Hyderabad; 550 kg marijuana seized
224.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 36-year-old interstate drug peddler, identified as Venkatesh, and seized 550 kg marijuana from him. The police also seized a vehicle and two mobile phones from the accused. One of the accused, Vijay Prasad, allegedly asked Venkatesh, a taxi driver, to transport the contraband to Maharashtra and offered him a sum of ₹1.5 lakh per trip.

225.title: Sensex falls nearly 1,100 points, Nifty ends below 17,600
225.article_body: The benchmark indices ended in the red on Friday with the Sensex falling 1,093.22 points to 58,840.79. The Nifty ended 346.60 points lower at 17,530.80. Most sectors, including auto, IT, metal, banks and realty stocks plunged. Tech Mahindra, Infosys and M&M were among the top losers on the exchanges. Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 fell in range of 2.5%-3%.

226.title: Sonal Chauhan fractures foot, completes 'The Ghost' action sequence
226.article_body: Actress Sonal Chauhan recently fractured her foot during MMA training for her film 'The Ghost' and was advised to avoid any training or action scenes for six weeks. The actress completed shooting an action sequence for the film despite her injury. A picture of Sonal with her foot in the plaster is going viral on social media.

227.title: 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist' was wrapped in 45 days: Sunny Deol
227.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has stated that his upcoming film 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist' was shot within 45 days by director R Balki. "He is really a great professional with a great vision. He knows what he wants and is very precise with his work," Sunny added. The film also features Dulquer Salmaan, Shreya Dhanwanthary and Pooja Bhatt.

228.title: Wife finds out her husband was a woman 8 years after marriage in Gujarat; FIR filed
228.article_body: A woman in Gujarat's Vadodara approached the police against her husband of eight years after learning that he has allegedly undergone gender affirmation surgery. The woman said the accused went to Kolkata in 2020 for surgery to implant male organs in his body under the false pretext of undergoing minor surgery. An FIR has been registered in the case.

229.title: KGF 2 created history, saved Kannada film industry: Mahesh Manjrekar
229.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar has stated that Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' saved the Kannada film industry which seemed like "it would shut down anytime". "But there was one person who believed in making a film and spending a lot of money on it. That person made a film named KGF and it created history," Mahesh said.

230.title: 3 arrested after encounter with police in Ghaziabad
230.article_body: Three men were arrested by Ghaziabad Police on Friday following an encounter in the Loni border area, police informed. Firearms and stolen property were recovered from them, police added. One of the accused was reportedly shot in the leg while a fourth one managed to escape. The encounter occurred after the accused tried to evade a routine check, police said.

231.title: Haryana Police to expedite training of 5,000 officers amid rise in cybercrime
231.article_body: The crime branch of Haryana Police has decided to speed up online training of over 5,000 willing policemen and officers in cybercrime investigation. The move has been initiated so that police can cope with rising number of cybercrimes in the state. Notably, 36,996 cybercrime complaints were received by state police till August this year, Haryana ADGP (Crime) OP Singh said.

232.title: 100 families in dark after supply cut in Noida society over power theft by builder
232.article_body: At least 100 families in Noida's Hilston Urbtech Society have been living in total blackout for four days after the electricity supply was snapped following allegations of power theft against the builder. The builder had reportedly taken a temporary connection of 50kW during construction. He didn't take a permanent connection later and continued to supply 750kW power from same line.

233.title: Mother asks Delhi HC to let 16-yr-old daughter terminate pregnancy
233.article_body: A woman has approached the Delhi High Court seeking permission to terminate the pregnancy of her 16-year-old daughter. The minor girl is over 17 weeks pregnant as per the ultrasound scan. The pregnancy is said to have resulted from a consensual and close relationship. The petitioner's lawyer said the girl is not physically and mentally prepared to raise a child.

234.title: BTech aspirant leaves home in Pune as father forces him to study medicine
234.article_body: A 17-year-old youth ran away from home in Pune and went missing on Tuesday, following an argument with his father over studies and phone usage. He was found at his uncle's house in Dighi. An engineering aspirant, the boy told police he left home as he wanted to pursue computer science, but his father was forcing him to study medicine.

235.title: House collapses in Delhi's Johripur Extension; 6 rescued, 2 trapped
235.article_body: A house collapsed in Johripur Extension in Northeast Delhi on Friday afternoon, Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said. "So far, six persons have been rescued...it is suspected that two more are there," DFS chief Atul Garg added. The rescue work is underway, he added. A video of the incident purportedly shows the house collapsing inwards while the walls remain intact.

236.title: Emma Thompson calls Shabana 'simply wonderful', latter shares message
236.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi took to Instagram on Friday to share a message sent by Hollywood actress Emma Thompson. The message read, "My darling, I just saw the film and you are simply wonderful in it and it is absolutely fantastic...Sending you all my love." The two will be seen together in Shekhar Kapur's 'What's Love Got to Do with It?'

237.title: 4 dead in separate incidents of wall collapse in UP's Unnao
237.article_body: Four people, including two children, died in separate incidents of wall collapse in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, officials said on Friday. Of the deceased, three are members of the same family who died when the wall of their house collapsed due to overnight rainfall. State CM Yogi Adityanath has announced ₹4 lakh financial assistance to each of the deceased's families.

238.title: Mumbai Police bust interstate gang of car thieves; 7 arrested
238.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested seven members of an interstate gang of car thieves and seized five cars worth at least ₹59 lakh. The accused used to change the number plates of cars involved in accidents with the number plates of robbed vehicles before selling them across Maharashtra. The racket was busted after a 25-year-old car dealer registered an FIR.

239.title: CEO compares Uber prices in B'luru to flight ticket from B'luru-Mumbai, people react
239.article_body: The Ken CEO Rohin Dharmakumar recently criticised high prices of Uber ride to Bengaluru airport. "A 1 hour Uber to Bengaluru airport costs 60-130% the price of a 1.5 hour flight to Mumbai," he tweeted. "Use Indian railways airport link train and shuttle bus," a comment read while another person joked, "It could...take longer to...[reach]...Bengaluru airport than flying to Mumbai."

240.title: Munawar dismisses breakup rumours with Nazila, shares video of her
240.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to dismiss rumours of his breakup with social media influencer Nazila. He can be seen focusing the camera on Nazila and saying, "Yeh kya phook k kar rahe hai ye log? Kya phook rahe hai ye log kya malum (What are people smoking and doing? I don't know)."

241.title: Suppression of local languages led to Hyd's annexation: Freedom fighter
241.article_body: A 94-year-old freedom fighter on Friday stated that the suppression of local languages like Telugu, Marathi and Kannada by Nizam rulers triggered a movement that led to the annexation of Hyderabad into India. Bhagwanrao Deshpande recalled that Urdu was imposed as the medium of education. Apart from language, issues like employment imbalance and culture were also raised, he added.

242.title: Amit Shah to arrive in Hyd today for 'Liberation Day' celebrations
242.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah is set to arrive in Hyderabad today (Friday) to take part in the 'Hyderabad Liberation Day' celebrations of the central government. The minister will unfurl the national flag at the Parade Ground and kick off the celebrations on Saturday. In another event, Shah will distribute equipment to specially-abled people to celebrate PM Narendra Modi's birthday.

243.title: ₹3 cr raised for US teen ordered to pay family of her rapist who was killed by her
243.article_body: An online fundraiser for a US teenager, who was ordered to pay $150,000 (around ₹1.2 crore) to the family of her rapist as restitution for killing him, has raised $442,000 (around ₹3.5 crore). The 17-year-old Iowa resident was trafficked at 15. She was allegedly drugged and assaulted by a 37-year-old man in 2020, following which she killed him.

244.title: 'Brahmastra' crosses ₹200-cr mark in India, earns over ₹300 cr worldwide
244.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra' crossed the ₹300-crore mark at the global box office at the end of its first week. Meanwhile, the film has grossed over ₹200 crore at domestic box office. Sharing a video revealing box office figures of the film, producer Karan Johar tweeted, "Love and light ruling...global box office...Entering the second week with a heart full of...excitement!!"

245.title: He was the epitome of a champion: Evert on Federer's retirement
245.article_body: After 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer announced his retirement, ex-world number one Chris Evert tweeted, "He was the epitome of a champion; class, grace, humility, beloved by everyone." She added, "He elegantly mastered the sport like no other...Good luck to you, Federer don't go too far!" The 41-year-old Swiss will retire after next week's Laver Cup.

246.title: Putin thanks China's Xi for his 'balanced position' on Ukraine
246.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday thanked Chinese leader Xi Jinping for his "balanced position" on the Ukrainian crisis. This was the first face-to-face meeting between the two leaders since Russia launched its "special military operation" in Ukraine in February. Putin also told Xi that Moscow backs Beijing's "One China" policy and opposes "provocations" by the US in Taiwan Strait.

247.title: Fiji PM's son charged with domestic violence in Australia
247.article_body: The son of Fijian Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama has been charged with a series of domestic violence offences in Australia. Ratu Meli Bainimarama is facing 17 charges, including stalking, assault and choking without consent. The offences allegedly took place in Sydney between February and May 2022, but the 36-year-old was arrested last week. He has been granted bail.

248.title: Saudi man marries 53 times in 43 years, says 'Was looking for peace of mind, stability'
248.article_body: A Saudi man has claimed to have married 53 times in 43 years, saying he was "looking for peace of mind and stability". The 63-year-old man told Saudi-owned television MBC that he is now married to one woman and does not plan to remarry. Abu Abdullah said he had also married foreigners during his overseas business trips.

249.title: Can't keep scaring people like this with ED, CBI: Kejriwal to BJP
249.article_body: Reacting to the sting operation claims by the BJP, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the government can't keep scaring people like this with ED and CBI. "Earlier, one BJP leader claimed it was fraud worth ₹1.5 lakh crore...Delhi's total budget is ₹70,000 crore. How can the scam be worth that amount?," said Kejriwal.

250.title: Woman jumps into well with her 2 children in Chhattisgarh, all die
250.article_body: A 23-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide by jumping into a well along with her two children in Chhattisgarh's Korba district on Thursday morning. Girja had left the house when all other family members were asleep, police said. A search was subsequently launched following which bodies of Girja, her two-year-old daughter and six-month-old son were found floating in the well.

251.title: When SRK threw Shilpa off balcony in 'Baazigar', audience screamed: Makers
251.article_body: Director duo Abbas Mustan recalled watching their film 'Baazigar' in a theatre and said that when Shah Rukh Khan's character threw Shilpa Shetty's character off the balcony, the audience screamed. "When he walks off from the crime scene, people started clapping, whistling. We did not expect this kind of reaction. The reaction was, 'This man is a superstar'," they added.

252.title: US' Warburg in talks to buy $150 million stake in Vistaar: Report
252.article_body: US private equity firm Warburg Pincus LLC is in advanced talks with Bengaluru-based small-business lender Vistaar Finance to acquire 30% stake in the company, Reuters reported citing sources. Warburg is reportedly looking to spend around $150 million to buy the stake. According to the report, the deal will value Vistaar at roughly $450 million.

253.title: Sushant Singh Rajput was murdered: Aamir Khan's brother Faissal
253.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's brother Faissal Khan has stated in an interview that late actor Sushant Singh Rajput was murdered. "When the case will open or not, only time will tell. There are many agencies involved," he added. Faissal further said that the investigation is going on. "I pray that the truth comes out so that everyone knows," he said.

254.title: Massive fire at skyscraper in China; video surfaces
254.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a skyscraper in the central Chinese city of Changsha, according to state media. Video of the fire surfaced on social media with state media saying that the number of casualties was "currently unknown". "Thick smoke is spewing from the site, and several dozen floors are burning ferociously," state broadcaster CCTV added.

255.title: I'm glad 'Jogi' is a digital release, it will reach a wider audience: Diljit
255.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has stated that he is glad that his film 'Jogi' is a digital release since it will reach a wider audience. Diljit attended the OTT launch of 'Jogi' virtually. The Ali Abbas Zafar directorial is based on the 1984 Sikh riots which began after the assassination of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

256.title: Tencent fires nearly all staff of its gaming firm Fanbyte: Reports
256.article_body: Tencent has reportedly fired nearly all employees of its online gaming publication Fanbyte. The company's editor-in-chief, head of media and several writers were among those who were fired, according to a tweet by a remaining employee. As per TechCrunch, Fanbyte's Instagram profile was accessed by fired social media manager, who changed its display name to 'forgot the keys?'

257.title: CBI, ED troubling everyone, still don't understand scam in liquor policy: Kejriwal
257.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday alleged Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and Enforcement Directorate (ED) were "unnecessarily troubling everyone", but he still didn't understand what the liquor scam was all about. "One of their (BJP) leaders says it's a scam of ₹8,000 crore...LG says it's...₹144 crore and CBI FIR says there's a scam of ₹1 crore," Kejriwal said.

258.title: 4th year IIT Madras student from Odisha found dead in hostel room
258.article_body: A 21-year-old IIT Madras student from Odisha was found dead in his hostel room in a suspected suicide case on Thursday. The fourth-year aerospace engineering student, Subhranshu Sarkar, had backlogs and was reportedly stressed about it, said police. The parents of the deceased were called. The police are conducting an inquiry, while the body was sent for post-mortem.

259.title: Germany takes control of Russian oil giant Rosneft's subsidiary
259.article_body: Germany's Federal Network Agency has taken control of Russian oil firm Rosneft's subsidiary in Germany, the Economy Ministry said, adding the move would counter the "threat to the security of energy supply". The agency will control Rosneft Deutschland GmbH and RN Refining & Marketing GmbH and its shares in three refineries. Rosneft accounts for 12% of Germany's oil processing capacity.

260.title: Design studio behind Coke, PVR partners with Masters' Union for UX course
260.article_body: Masters’ Union has launched a 6-month User Experience Design part-time program in collaboration with Onething Design, a design studio which has worked with Coca Cola, PVR and Noise. Taught by UX designers, the program aims to help students bag UI/UX jobs by building a portfolio, working on real client projects, paid internships at Onething Design and over 20+ placement drives.

261.title: Harshal can't bowl yorkers, leaks runs when he bowls seam-up: Sarandeep
261.article_body: Ex-Team India selector Sarandeep Singh said Team India pacer Harshal Patel cannot bowl bouncers or yorkers. "Every time he...[bowls seam-up], he gets hit for runs," added Sarandeep. Discussing Team India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Sarandeep stated, "Mohammad Shami shouldn't have gone out...What he can do with the new ball, I don't think any other bowler can."

262.title: Jacqueline called Sukesh 'man of her dreams', wanted to marry him: Reports
262.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez was so convinced and influenced by Sukesh Chandrasekhar that she would call him the "man of her dreams" and was thinking of marrying him, ANI reported while quoting sources. Special Commissioner of Police, EOW, Ravindra Yadav said, "There is more trouble for Jacqueline as she did not cut ties with Sukesh even after knowing his criminal antecedents."

263.title: Very shocking: Akram on Shahid Afridi saying Shaheen had to spend own money for rehab
263.article_body: Reacting to Shahid Afridi saying that Shaheen Afridi had to spend his own money for his injury rehab and Pakistan Cricket Board didn't do anything for the fast bowler, Wasim Akram said, "This is very shocking." He added, "If it's true...then it's wrong on PCB's part. He should have straightaway been sent to the best knee surgeon in the world."

264.title: Congress urges KCR to reinstall Ambedkar's statue in Hyderabad's Panjagutta
264.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao hailed Telangana CM KCR for naming the new Secretariat after BR Ambedkar and urged him to reinstall his statue which was earlier removed in 2019 in Panjagutta, Hyderabad. "You are doing a good job by naming the Secretariat after Ambedkar and appealing to the Centre to name the new Parliament after his name," said Rao.

265.title: IndusInd Bank shares gain 4% on reappointment of Kathpalia as CEO
265.article_body: Shares of IndusInd Bank gained nearly 4% intraday on Friday following the news of the reappointment of Sumant Kathpalia as the Managing Director and CEO for another three years. Its stock was trading 2% higher at ₹1,219.80 apiece on NSE at 2 pm. Kathpalia was first made the MD and CEO of the private lender in March 2020.

266.title: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh to join BJP next week
266.article_body: Former two-time Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh and Punjab Lok Congress (PLC) chief will join BJP next week, the party spokesperson confirmed on Friday. PLC will also reportedly merge with BJP on September 19. Singh will join BJP in the presence of party president JP Nadda and other leaders in Delhi. Singh formed PLC in 2021 after quitting Congress.

267.title: Glad India is one of the fastest growing economies: PM at SCO Summit
267.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in Uzbekistan's Samarkand, said that India's economy is expected to grow at the rate of 7.5% this year. "I'm glad that ours is one of the fastest growing economies among the largest economies of the world," he added. Furthermore, he said, "We are focusing on people-centric development model."

268.title: 2 police officers stabbed in area just minutes away from where the Queen's coffin is placed
268.article_body: Two police officers were stabbed by a man on Friday in a London area that is just minutes away from where the Queen's coffin has been placed. Police said that the incident, which took place near Leicester Square, is not being treated as terror-related. "Enquiries into the circumstances surrounding the incident are ongoing," police added.

269.title: Higher rate hikes could risk global recession in 2023: World Bank
269.article_body: World Bank has warned that with central banks simultaneously hiking interest rates, the economy could go towards a global recession. With US, China and the Euro-area economies slowing, even a "moderate hit to the global economy...could tip it into recession", it said. The global core inflation rate could stay at about 5% in 2023, nearly double the five-year pre-COVID-19 average.

270.title: I am the best Batman, Ben Affleck got nothing on me: George Clooney
270.article_body: Actor George Clooney said during a recent appearance that people look at him and think 'Oh, he's just the best Batman'. The actor further said that actor Ben Affleck is "the best available" Batman. "Really though, Ben Affleck, really? He's got nothing on me!" George added. Other actors who have portrayed Batman include Michael Keaton, Val Kilmer and Christian Bale.

271.title: US announces new $600 million arms package for Ukraine
271.article_body: The US on Thursday announced a new $600 million arms package to help the Ukrainian military battle Russia. The package includes High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS), Claymore mines, 105mm artillery rounds and 155mm precision-guided artillery rounds, the Pentagon said. Since Russia invaded Ukraine in February, the US has provided more than $15 billion in military assistance to Ukraine.

272.title: We'd say 'Get Rohit, Kohli out, half of Team India's finished': Asghar Afghan
272.article_body: Discussing his team's approach while playing against Team India, ex-Afghanistan captain Asghar Afghan said, "Our plan used to be around Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli." "We'd say 'Get them out, half of Team India's finished'...We used to believe...if we get...them out early, then...100-120 runs would be less from India's total in an ODI and...60-70 runs in a T20I," added Afghan.

273.title: Musk accuses Twitter of data security failures in amended lawsuit
273.article_body: Elon Musk has amended his lawsuit against Twitter to include allegations made against the platform by whistleblower Peiter Zatko. The amended lawsuit accused Twitter of fraud for concealing serious data security flaws in the social media company. The "newest revelations make undeniably clear" that Musk has "the full right to walk away" from $44 billion Twitter buyout deal, it stated.

274.title: 'RRR' became word-of-mouth hit in West, never expected it: Rajamouli
274.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has stated that his film 'RRR' became a word-of-mouth hit in the West, adding that he never expected the film to do so well with Western audiences. "I thought the sensibilities are different...I am still trying to understand, to be very frank," he added. Rajamouli had appeared for a chat at the ongoing Toronto International Film Festival.

275.title: WB tops in 100 days work for which Centre not releasing funds: Mamata
275.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the central government for 'not releasing' funds for 100 days work and other schemes implemented in the state. "Bengal tops the 100 days work scheme for which the central government is not releasing...money," Mamata said. She further criticised BJP and CPI(M) leaders for creating obstacles in the implementation of the 'Deocha Pachami' mining project.

276.title: We were tiger & leopard state, will now be cheetah state: MP CM
276.article_body: A day before eight cheetahs will arrive in India, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said it would be the biggest event for wildlife in this decade and a dream come true. "We were a tiger state, leopard state and now becoming a cheetah state," he said. We prepared the Kuno National Park for this 20 years ago, he added.

277.title: Sensex crashes 1,050 points, Nifty below 17,600 dragged by IT, auto stocks
277.article_body: The benchmark indices declined in the afternoon trade on Friday, dragged by IT, automobiles and metal stocks. The Sensex crashed by 1,050 points to 58,882, whereas the Nifty fell below 17,600, down 327 points at 17,550. All sectoral indices were trading in the red in the afternoon, with the IT, auto and metal indices shedding more than 2% each.

278.title: Fumbled on first shot while shooting with SRK for 'Brahmāstra': Mouni Roy
278.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has revealed that she had "an out-of-body experience" while shooting with actor Shah Rukh Khan for 'Brahmāstra'. "The first day I was going to shoot with SRK, some ADs came to the room and said, 'Please be well prepared' and memorise all your lines'...I went on set and fumbled on the first word," the actress said.

279.title: Woman, her daughter insult judiciary in a court in Mumbai; booked
279.article_body: Mumbai Police have booked an 80-year-old woman and her 52-year-old daughter after they allegedly interrupted a judicial proceeding and insulted the judiciary in Girgaon court. The duo was upset about the next date granted by an additional metropolitan magistrate, the police said. A judicial clerk said, "The screaming was so loud that the staffers of another court...asked about the shouting."

280.title: Dunzo agent runs behind moving train to deliver package to passenger; video goes viral
280.article_body: A video of a Dunzo agent running behind a moving train to deliver a package to a passenger standing at the train's door is going viral online. The customer can be seen celebrating after successfully receiving the package. Social media users compared the incident with Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge's climax scene, with a user saying, "DDLJ 2 leaked scene."

281.title: Manforce Condoms maker Mankind Pharma files draft papers for IPO
281.article_body: Mankind Pharma, the drug maker known for Manforce Condoms and Prega News brands, has filed draft papers for an IPO with SEBI. The offer only comprises an offer-for-sale portion of 4 crore equity shares by existing shareholders and promoters. Mankind reportedly plans to raise at least $700 million in one of the biggest IPOs ever attempted by a pharma company.

282.title: Lucknow administration issues advisory after wall collapse due to heavy rainfall kills 9
282.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow district administration on Friday issued an advisory after a wall collapse in Dilkusha area due to heavy rainfall killed nine persons. "All government, non-government and private schools will remain closed today," the administration said. It has advised people to not leave their houses until it is "indispensable". This comes amid an alert of more rainfall till Saturday.

283.title: US will cross red line if it sends longer-range missiles to Ukraine: Russia
283.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry has said that the US would cross a "red line" and become "a party to the conflict" if it sends longer-range missiles to Ukraine. Moscow "reserves the right to defend its territory", it added. The US has already provided Ukraine with advanced GMLRS rockets fired from HIMARS launchers, which can hit targets up to 80 km away.

284.title: Hydrogen peroxide leaks from truck carrying containers in Pune
284.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority's fire brigade responded to a leak of hydrogen peroxide from a truck which was carrying containers of the chemical on a highway in Shindewadi on Friday. The leak possibly occurred due to pressure from the containers kept above, a fire officer said. "We used water sprays to dilute...leaked chemical as per...guidelines," the fire officer added.

285.title: Bihar Police arrests all 4 accused in Begusarai firing case
285.article_body: Bihar Police has arrested all four accused in the Begusarai firing case. The accused persons have been identified as Keshav, Sumit, Yuvraj and Arjun. The firing incident led to the death of one person and at least nine others were injured. The bike-borne assailants had opened fire on random people at multiple locations in Begusarai.

286.title: TN tells HC it won't return leased elephants including Joymala to Assam
286.article_body: After Assam government filed a PIL, Tamil Nadu government told Madras High Court that it won't return the leased elephants, including Joymala, to Assam government. This comes following allegations that Joymala was being tortured at a temple in Tamil Nadu. Earlier, environment ministry shared a video of Joymala and supported Tamil Nadu government's claim that the elephant was doing well.

287.title: PM's plan to derail Bharat Jodo Yatra: Congress on ED summons to Shivakumar
287.article_body: After Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar received summons from the Enforcement Directorate (ED), party leader Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Modi, alleging that it was part of his tactics to derail the Bharat Jodo Yatra. "But he (PM Modi) won't succeed," Jairam tweeted. "Such cowardly acts will strengthen our resolve to decimate the corrupt Bommai...government," Randeep Singh Surjewala said.

288.title: ED freezes ₹46 crore kept in payment gateway accounts in Chinese loan apps case
288.article_body: The ED has detected and frozen funds worth ₹46.67 crore kept in payment gateways Paytm, Easebuzz, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments after recent raids in the Chinese loan apps case. The agency had conducted searches at six premises in Delhi, Ghaziabad, Mumbai, Lucknow, Gaya under PMLA, 2002, on Wednesday. The investigation was conducted against app-based token named HPZ and related entities.

289.title: I know nothing about Brahmāstra 2, want Ayan to see where Junoon goes: Mouni
289.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has stated that she wants 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji to put his thought into where her character Junoon goes after the first film. She added that she knows nothing about part two. "Ayan [came to me on set and told] me to not forget my connection to Shiv ji and Junoon's devotion to Brahmadev," the actress said.

290.title: I don't know if I'm that graceful: Sara on playing Sharmila in her biopic
290.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan was recently asked if she could portray her grandmother veteran actress Sharmila Tagore in her biopic. She said, "She's so graceful. I don't know if I'm graceful...She's so well-read...such a classy lady and she's had such a life." The actress further said that she has spent more time talking to her about worldviews than her craft.

291.title: CMs of Assam and Mizoram to hold talks on Monday over border dispute
291.article_body: Chief Minister of Assam Himanta Biswa Sarma and his Mizoram counterpart Zoramthanga will hold the second round of talks in New Delhi on Monday to settle the border dispute between the two states. Mizoram shares a 164.6-km border with Assam and the dispute over it is linked to colonial demarcations in 1875 and 1933.

292.title: Teacher thrashes 14-yr-old student for asking to go to toilet in UP
292.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit student was allegedly thrashed by a teacher for seeking permission to go to the toilet in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. According to police, the teacher denied the permission initially and when asked for the second time, he beat up the student with a stick, leaving him unconscious. The teacher was arrested and booked under the SC/ST Act.

293.title: Violent protests erupt after man dies in police custody in UP
293.article_body: Violent protests erupted after an electrician, 22-year-old Dev Narayan Yadav called for questioning in a murder case, died in police custody in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda. The protesters reportedly vandalised multiple police vehicles and a petrol pump, and attacked policemen. They demanded immediate arrest of those responsible and a financial assistance of ₹50 lakh for the victim's family.

294.title: Gautam Adani becomes 2nd richest man in the world as per Forbes
294.article_body: Adani Group's Chairperson Gautam Adani's wealth surged to make him the second richest man in the world on Friday, according to the Forbes' billionaire's list. While the richest man Elon Musk's net worth stood at $273.5 billion, Adani's net worth rose to $154.7 billion followed by Bernard Arnault and family's $153.8 billion and Jeff Bezos' $149.7 billion, as per Forbes.

295.title: I'm worried about content in mainstream Hindi cinema: Pankaj Tripathi
295.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said he is worried about the kind of content that is being made in mainstream Hindi cinema. "My taste in cinema is very different. I watch films like 'Thithi' and 'Court', I don't consume much mainstream Hindi content," he added. Pankaj further said that only a few South Indian films have been hits while the rest flopped.

296.title: Orange alert for Pune's Ghat areas today, rainfall till Saturday: IMD
296.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert for Pune's Ghat areas for Friday and added that very heavy rainfall is likely till Saturday. Pune city will receive moderate intensity rainfall on Friday and cloudy sky conditions will prevail throughout the day, IMD added. Pune's Lavasa received the highest rainfall of 104 mm in the last 24 hours.

297.title: There's no cancel culture in south, heard about it in B'wood: Dulquer
297.article_body: Speaking about the boycott Bollywood trends, actor Dulquer Salmaan stated that there is no cancel culture in the south and he heard about it first in Bollywood. He added that the trend is overpowering these days because of social media. "You can write anything, so people start writing things with their own agendas without any responsibilities," the actor said.

298.title: Criticism is audience's right, but 'Brahmāstra' set fire to box office: Alia
298.article_body: Reacting to the negative reviews of 'Brahmāstra', actress Alia Bhatt said that it is the audience's right, adding that she hopes the positives are more than the negatives. "Positive hi zyada hai varna jo box office pe aag lagayi hai voh hota nahi (It seems more positive otherwise the film won't have set fire to the box office)," she added.

299.title: Gautam Adani briefly becomes 2nd richest man in the world as per Forbes
299.article_body: Adani Group's Chairperson Gautam Adani's wealth surged to briefly make him the second richest man in the world on Friday, according to the Forbes' billionaire's list. He had briefly surpassed the net worth of Bernard Arnault and family ($155.2 billion), as per Forbes. Adani, whose net worth stood over $154.8 billion, is ahead of Jeff Bezos' $149.7 billion, Forbes stated.

300.title: Congress workers demand ₹2,000 from Kerala vendor for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', threaten him
300.article_body: Three Congress workers have been suspended for threatening a vegetable vendor in Kerala's Kollam after he did not pay ₹2,000 as a donation to the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. Kerala Congress president K Sudhakaran said the party was "crowdfunding small donations voluntarily", and the workers' behaviour was "inexcusable". A video of the incident surfaced on social media.

301.title: World's oldest heart found in 380-million-year-old fish in Australia, say researchers
301.article_body: Researchers from Australia's Curtin University discovered a 380-million-year-old heart preserved inside a fossilised prehistoric fish, claiming it to be the world's oldest heart. The researchers also found fossilised stomach, intestine and liver in the ancient jawed fish. The discovery is remarkable as the fish's soft tissues were rarely preserved, said lead researcher Professor Kate Trinajstic.

302.title: Shama Sikander reveals she faced casting couch, says 'This concept is lowest of low'
302.article_body: Revealing that she faced casting couch, TV actress Shama Sikander said, "I have had producers tell me that they wanted to be friends with me. I was like, how can we be friends if we do not work together." "I feel the whole concept of asking for sex in return for work is the lowest of low," she added.

303.title: Tharoor shares pic with Federer, says 'My favourite tennis star after Amritraj'
303.article_body: Shashi Tharoor took to Twitter to share a picture with Roger Federer after the tennis legend announced retirement. "My favourite tennis star after Vijay Amritraj. Sad," Tharoor tweeted. "I saw Federer playing live at the 2003 Australian Open; he lost in the QF but impressed me more than the victor," he added.

304.title: Hungary can no longer be considered a full democracy: EU Parliament
304.article_body: Hungary can no longer be considered a "full democracy" and EU needs to do everything to bring it back into line with European values, the European Parliament said on Thursday. As many as 433 Members of European Parliament (MEPs) voted in favour of a resolution to describe Hungary, ruled by PM Viktor Orban, as "a hybrid regime of electoral autocracy".

305.title: Vedanta shares fall 6% after firm's clarification on chip plant
305.article_body: Vedanta Limited's shares fell by 6% on Friday after the Anil Agarwal-led company issued a clarification that the proposed Vedanta-Foxconn semiconductors business will be undertaken by Vedanta's ultimate holding company, Volcan Investments Limited, and not Vedanta. At 12.10 am, its stock was trading 6.2% lower at ₹294.6 apiece on the NSE. Volcan is wholly owned by the Agarwal family trust.

306.title: Medical college in Ahmedabad to be renamed after PM Modi
306.article_body: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has decided to rename a medical college after PM Narendra Modi. The civic body-run AMC MET Medical College will be known as 'Narendra Modi Medical College', announced AMC's Standing Committee Chairman Hitesh Barot. The proposal to rename the college, which was sent by the executive committee of AMC MET on September 14, has been cleared.

307.title: New T'gana secretariat complex to be named after BR Ambedkar: CM KCR
307.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Thursday decided to name the state's new secretariat complex, which is currently under construction, after BR Ambedkar. "Ambedkar's spirit guides us in implementing the federal spirit," KCR said on the decision. He further added that he would write a letter to PM Modi requesting him to name the new Parliament building after Ambedkar.

308.title: Govt revises definition of 'small' firms, doubles threshold for paid-up capital
308.article_body: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs has revised the definition of 'small' companies, doubling the threshold for paid-up capital and turnover to not exceeding ₹4 crore and ₹40 crore, respectively. With this change, the 'small' companies will not need to prepare cash flow statement as part of the financial statement and can hold only two board meetings in a year.

309.title: 12-member task force formed to control lumpy skin disease in Maharashtra
309.article_body: In order to control lumpy skin disease in the state, the Maharashtra government has formed a 12-member task force. It will be led by Pune's Commissioner of Animal Husbandry department. The task force members are authorised to hold meetings with the department's officials of affected districts and representatives of vaccine producers for lumpy skin disease.

310.title: Himachal to name 1 college library in each district after Ambedkar
310.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Cabinet on Thursday decided to name one library in a college in every district across the state as 'Dr Bhim Rao Ambedkar District Library' as a mark of respect for the Founder of the Indian Constitution. The state cabinet also expressed its gratitude to the Centre and BJP's national leaders for according Scheduled Tribe status to Hatti community.

311.title: PM Modi poses with China's Xi, Russia's Putin for group photo at SCO Summit
311.article_body: PM Narendra Modi posed for a group photo, along with Chinese President Xi Jinping, Russian President Vladimir Putin, Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and other leaders, at the 22nd Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in Uzbekistan's Samarkand. He landed in Samarkand on Thursday night to take part in the summit. PM Modi is set to meet Russian President Putin on Friday.

312.title: Wanted to break TV while watching: Aaqib Javed on Pak's Asia Cup performance
312.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said he felt like "breaking his TV" while watching Pakistan's performances in Asia Cup 2022. "70% of [these] players don't deserve to play for Pakistan," he added. Discussing Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Aaqib stated, "[The selectors] have made mistakes...Pakistan will be the first team...in...T20 World Cup whose number four hasn't...won a game."

313.title: First visuals of Namibian cheetahs arriving in India on PM Modi's birthday surface
313.article_body: Videos showing first look of cheetahs that will be arriving in Madhya Pradesh from Namibia on PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday have surfaced online. As many as eight cheetahs will be arriving from the country and PM Modi will release them in Kuno National Park. A special plane has been sent to Namibia to bring the cheetahs.

314.title: Over 50 ex-bureaucrats write to ECI seeking de-recognition of AAP
314.article_body: Over 50 retired bureaucrats have written to the Election Commission of India (ECI) seeking de-recognition of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for inducing public servants to work for the party in Gujarat. "His (Kejriwal's) appeal to drivers...of public transport corporations and police personnel to work for a particular party is very wrong," said former Karnataka Additional Chief Secretary, M Madan Gopal.

315.title: Rahul watches Kathakali as Bharat Jodo Yatra resumes from Kollam
315.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi watched an artist perform Kathakali during his party's Bharat Jodo Yatra, which resumed from Polayathodu in Kerala's Kollam district on Friday. Gandhi is expected to interact with workers, entrepreneurs and others at Neendakara today. The foot march, which aims to cover 3,570 km from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir in 150 days, was launched on September 7.

316.title: Texas sends 2 buses of migrants to US Vice President Harris' home
316.article_body: Texas Governor Greg Abbott on Thursday said he has intentionally sent two migrant buses carrying over 100 people to US Vice President Kamala Harris' residence in Washington DC. "Texas will continue sending migrants to sanctuary cities like Washington DC until President [Joe] Biden and Border Czar Harris step up and do their jobs to secure the border," he added.

317.title: Pic showing comet's tail being torn away by powerful solar wind wins photography prize
317.article_body: A rare photograph of a comet that will never be seen from the Earth again has won the Astronomy Photographer of the Year Competition in the 'Planets, Comets and Asteroids' category. The image, which was captured by Gerald Rhemann, shows a piece of Comet Leonard's tail breaking off and being carried away by a powerful solar wind.

318.title: Rahul Gandhi doesn't have knowledge of northeast: Pema Khandu
318.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu dismissed Rahul Gandhi's claims of Chinese incursion and claimed that the Congress MP does not have much knowledge about the northeast. "Saw on social media that Chinese entered (Indian side) and are constructing again...The Opposition's claims are wrong. I say confidently there's no Chinese intrusion in Arunachal," said Khandu.

319.title: The way they lost, it hurts: Miandad on Pak's Asia Cup final defeat
319.article_body: Discussing Pakistan's loss against Sri Lanka in Asia Cup 2022 final, Javed Miandad said, "Players will benefit from my presence...The way they lost, it hurts." Expressing his anger at PCB for not including ex-Pakistan players in the team setup, Miandad added, "It's...shameful. You've so many people...where's your nationalism?" "These kids...just go...and start hitting," he stated.

320.title: I am not scared of anything: Azad on death threats by terrorists
320.article_body: Reacting to the reports of death threats by terrorists, former J&K CM Ghulam Nabi Azad claimed that he is not scared of anything. "I heard about the reports that terrorists have issued a threat to kill me. They have said I met Amit Shah and Ajit Doval before coming here. I have never met Doval in my life," he said.

321.title: Pune residents sit in potholes in protest, seek urgent repairs
321.article_body: Residents in Pune on Thursday staged a protest near Bhekrai Nagar chowk over potholes on roads causing accidents, with some protesters even sitting in the potholes. The residents have also sought urgent repairs on the roads. A father-daughter duo had died on a potholed road while on the way to drop the girl at school, the protesters claimed.

322.title: 15-year-old Thane girl claims she was forced to marry, tortured
322.article_body: A case was filed against four people in Thane after a 15-year-old girl claimed that she was forcibly married to a man who then sexually exploited and tortured her, an official said. The girl had shifted to Muzaffarpur with the man, however, when she came back to her parents in Thane, she told them about her ordeal, the official said.

323.title: ED conducts raids at 40 locations across India in Delhi excise policy case
323.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Friday morning conducted raids at 40 locations spread across multiple states in connection with the Delhi excise policy case. Raids are underway at premises linked to liquor businessmen, distributors and others in multiple cities including Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai. ED earlier conducted searches on September 6 at about 45 locations across India.

324.title: SRK came to our house at 4:30am after 'Baazigar' win: Abbas-Mustan
324.article_body: Filmmaking duo Abbas-Mustan revealed that Shah Rukh Khan came to their house at 4:30 in the morning after winning the Best Actor Filmfare Award for 1993 film 'Baazigar'. They added that Shah Rukh came along with Anu Malik and Ratan Jain among others. "Shah Rukh...hugged us and said...'I cannot go home with this trophy before taking your blessings'," they said.

325.title: 1,000 litres of adulterated milk seized in Mumbai's Dharavi, 6 arrested
325.article_body: The police on Thursday busted an adulteration racket in Mumbai's Dharavi and seized around 1010 litres of adulterated milk. Based on a tip-off, police raided houses involved in such activities and arrested six persons. The accused allegedly bought milk packets from companies including Gokul and Amul and added water to them. They then sealed the packets with a candle flame.

326.title: ATP shares pic of Roger Federer crying after French Open 2009 win, says 'Us right now'
326.article_body: Following the news of Roger Federer's retirement, ATP shared a picture of Federer crying after winning the French Open 2009. "Us right now," ATP captioned the picture. "I remember this moment so clearly...tennis won't be the same without Roger!" a fan wrote. Federer won a total of 20 Grand Slams in his career.

327.title: Pak board not doing anything for Shaheen, he's spending own money: Shahid Afridi on rehab
327.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has claimed that Pakistan Cricket Board is not doing anything for fast bowler Shaheen Afridi's injury rehab. "He went to England [for the rehab] on his own. He bought his own ticket, he spent his own money to stay in a hotel. I arranged a doctor for him," Shahid said.

328.title: 'Uber has suffered a data breach,' hacker tells employees; company starts probe
328.article_body: Uber's computer network suffered a breach on Thursday, leading the company to take several of its internal communications and engineering systems offline. A hacker compromised an Uber employee's Slack account and used it to send the message saying, "I am a hacker and Uber has suffered a data breach." Uber is investigating the breach, a company spokesperson said.

329.title: Karnataka Legislative Council passes anti-conversion bill amid protest
329.article_body: Karnataka Legislative Council on Thursday passed the Protection of Right to Freedom of Religion Bill, 2021 or the "anti-conversion bill", by a voice vote. "Amendments [to the bill] made to ensure forceful conversions stopped. We are passing this bill to protect religion and faith," state Law Minister JC Madhuswamy said. Congress staged a walkout while the bill was being tabled.

330.title: BitGo sues Galaxy Digital for $100 mn for terminating $1.2 bn deal
330.article_body: Crypto financial services firm, Galaxy Digital Holdings Limited, was sued by digital asset custodian BitGo Inc for at least $100 million in damages for terminating a $1.2-billion takeover deal. According to the lawsuit filed by BitGo, Galaxy Digital falsely blamed its accounting, whereas it was grappling with a collapse of digital currencies. Galaxy will seek to have the lawsuit dismissed.

331.title: Promise of bigger plant for Maharashtra is like consoling a child: Pawar
331.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar criticised Maharashtra CM for losing the Vedanta-Foxconn project to Gujarat and said that Centre's assurance of a bigger project to Maharashtra was like consoling a child. "Since the project has already gone out of Maharashtra, there is no possibility of getting it back...CM must lead to creating a favourable environment for the investors," Pawar said.

332.title: Indian-origin 'werewolf killer' who stabbed US man 50 times joins dating app; pic surfaces
332.article_body: Pankaj Bhasin, an Indian-origin man called 'werewolf killer' after stabbing a US man 50 times due to a psychiatric break four years ago, recently joined a dating site. After taking note, a US court ordered him to stay off social media till he's on conditional release. Bhasin is free on conditional release after spending three years in mental health facility.

333.title: Boeing will not sell 737 Max jets to China, to find new buyers
333.article_body: Boeing said it will not deliver some Boeing 737 Max jets that were built for Chinese airlines as China's aviation regulator has not cleared the plane to fly after two fatal crashes. It will instead find new buyers. Boeing had an inventory of 290 undelivered 737s as of June 30, out of which almost half was earmarked for China.

334.title: YouTuber Savukku Shankar gets 6-month jail for calling judiciary corrupt
334.article_body: Holding popular YouTuber Savukku Shankar guilty of criminal contempt for his remarks against the judiciary, the Madras High Court on Thursday sentenced him to six months imprisonment. In an interview, Shankar had said that the "entire higher judiciary is plagued by corruption". The judges said that they would have spared him had he realised his mistake and sincerely apologised.

335.title: I'm proud of breaking up with Kanye, he had a lot to work on: Julia
335.article_body: Actress-model Julia Fox said she is proud of breaking up with rapper Kanye West, adding he has a lot of unresolved issues he was dealing with. "It just seems like he had a lot to work on...I just don't have time for it," she added. Julia further said she would have stuck it out before the birth of her son.

336.title: Pakistan is moving around with a begging bowl in hand today: Pakistan PM
336.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif publicly admitted that his country is moving around with a begging bowl in hand today as it has failed to progress economically despite 75 years of independence. "Today, when we go to any friendly country or make a phone call, they think that we have come to beg for money," he said.

337.title: Manipur CM appeals for peace talks as 13 insurgents lay down arms
337.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Thursday appealed to all militant outfits to come for peace talks after 13 insurgents surrendered before him in Imphal. Of the insurgents who surrendered, 12 were from KCP-PWG and one was from KYKL. The militants laid down arms, including two grenade launchers, three pistols, two detonators and two radio sets, among others, PTI reported.

338.title: I've always compared Mahmudullah with MS Dhoni: Ex-India bowler Sriram
338.article_body: Ex-India bowler and Bangladesh coach Sridharan Sriram said he's "always compared" Mahmudullah Riyad with MS Dhoni considering his performances. "Mahmudullah...finished a lot of matches for Bangladesh," added Sriram. Talking about his conversation with Mahmudullah over not being a part of Bangladesh's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Sriram stated, "It is never...easy...I've to be the bad man."

339.title: GMDA to construct road overbridge at Gurugram's Palam Vihar
339.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) will construct a road overbridge connecting Gurugram's Palam Vihar and Sector 102 road with the Dwarka expressway. Residents living in Palam Vihar, Sectors 21, 22 and 23, along with people travelling from Delhi to Udyog Vihar and beyond will benefit from the project. The overbridge will be built at a cost of ₹68 crore.

340.title: Ex-US teacher charged with sex crimes after posting TikToks of students
340.article_body: A former elementary school teacher in US' Tennessee has been charged with 19 sex crimes, including rape and sexual battery by an authority figure, after allegedly posting inappropriate videos of her students on TikTok. However, the exact content of the videos has not been revealed yet. Taylor Cruze, who resigned as a fifth-grade teacher in May, was arrested in August.

341.title: Telugu industry is dominated by film families & their fans: Amala Paul
341.article_body: Speaking about leaving the Telugu film industry, actress Amala Paul stated that it is dominated by film families and their fans. "There would always be two actresses and we'd be there for the love scenes, songs and everything was very glamorous," the actress added. She further said they were very commercial films and she couldn't connect much with the industry.

342.title: J&K to declare Maharaja Hari Singh's birthday a public holiday
342.article_body: The birth anniversary of Maharaja Hari Singh, the last ruler of the erstwhile princely state of Jammu and Kashmir, will be declared a public holiday, according to an official statement. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha announced the decision after meeting with prominent political leaders, civil society members and others. Singh was a great educationist and a social reformer, said Sinha.

343.title: I told Babar 'Don't take up captaincy, reach Kohli's level first': Kamran
343.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Babar Azam after Babar was named as Pakistan's captain, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal said, "I told him, 'I don't think now is the right time for you to become captain'." "Reach Virat Kohli's level first...I told him back in the day but it was his decision," added Kamran elaborating on his advice to Babar.

344.title: CBI seeks WB leader Partha's custody in recruitment scam case
344.article_body: The CBI has filed a plea in a Kolkata court seeking custody of former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee in connection with the teachers' recruitment scam. "During interrogation, the five persons arrested by our officers revealed a lot of information, which clearly points at the role of the former Education Minister in the matter," said a CBI official.

345.title: I was listed as a billionaire, it pissed me off: Founder who donated US-based firm
345.article_body: Patagonia Founder Yvon Chouinard, who has donated his US-based company to fight climate change, said, "I was in Forbes magazine listed as a billionaire, which really, really pissed me off." The 83-year-old told The New York Times, "I don't have $1 billion in...bank. I don't drive Lexuses." Chouinard founded Patagonia 49 years ago and is valued at $3 billion today.

346.title: Hyderabad Metro was initially written off as a foolish idea, says MD
346.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Managing Director NVS Reddy on Thursday said, "The metro projects were originally written off by many experts as a foolish idea and a jinxed project." He was speaking as the Chief Guest at an Engineer's Day event at Anurag University. Citing the metro's example, Reddy encouraged students to be innovative, confident and to learn to face challenges.

347.title: Unfortunate, but he's happy: Nagarjuna on Samantha-Naga Chaitanya divorce
