347.article_body: Veteran actor Nagarjuna has called his son Naga Chaitanya's divorce with actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu unfortunate, saying that it's an experience that happened to his son. "We can't keep moping about it. It's gone. It's out of our lives," the actor said. Nagarjuna further said his son is happy and that's all he sees, adding that's good enough for him.

348.title: 7-yr-old dies after falling into pit at Pune construction site; 4 booked
348.article_body: A seven-year-old boy died after falling into a pit filled with rainwater at a construction site in Pune's Wagholi. The deceased's uncle on Wednesday lodged the first information report (FIR) at the Lonikand Police Station. Police have booked four persons of a construction firm under various sections of the Indian Penal Code.

349.title: Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds expecting their 4th child; pic shows actress with baby bump
349.article_body: Hollywood actress Blake Lively and actor Ryan Reynolds, who have three daughters James (7), Inez (5), and Betty (2), are expecting their fourth child. Pictures from Blake's appearance at the Forbes Power Women's Summit showed her with a baby bump. "I just like to create. Whether that's baking or storytelling or businesses or humans," the actress said at the event.

350.title: Hydrogen-powered trains to be ready by 2023: Railways Minister
350.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw while speaking at a university in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, said on Thursday that India is developing hydrogen-powered trains and they will be ready by next year. He also added that the Vande Bharat Express, which is the country's first indigenous semi-high speed train, "has been running smoothly without any major breakdown for the last two years".

351.title: Jimmy Neesham declines New Zealand central contract
351.article_body: All-rounder Jimmy Neesham has declined a central contract offered to him by New Zealand Cricket. "I know...news of my decision to decline a central contract...will be seen as me choosing money over representing my country," Neesham said. He added, "I had planned to accept...offer in July...however since being left off the list I've committed to other leagues around the world."

352.title: Sensex falls 400 points, Nifty below 17,800 in opening trade
352.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Friday amid weak global cues. The Sensex fell over 400 points to trade at 59,533, while the Nifty lost over 100 points to open below 17,800. Tech Mahindra, M&M, Wipro, Maruti Suzuki, Infosys and TCS were among the major losers. Stocks of Sun Pharma, Bajaj Finance and Asian Paints gained.

353.title: Supplying weapons to Ukraine morally acceptable: Pope Francis
353.article_body: Pope Francis said that it is "morally acceptable" for countries to provide weapons to Ukraine to help the country defend itself from Russian aggression. "It can be immoral if the intention is provoking more war," he added. Pope also urged Ukraine to be open to dialogue, even though it may "smell" because it would be difficult for the Ukrainian side.

354.title: India reports 6,298 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,748
354.article_body: India has reported 6,298 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 5,916 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 46,748. This comes a day after 6,422 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India.

355.title: Bodies of 440 people found in a grave in city recaptured from Russia by Ukraine
355.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have found bodies of over 440 people in a grave in the city of Izium that was recaptured from Russian forces. Serhiy Bolvinov, the chief police investigator for Kharkiv region, said that forensic investigations would be carried out on every body. "Russia is leaving death behind it everywhere and must be held responsible," Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

356.title: COVID-19 cases in B'luru rise marginally to 283, 1 death reported
356.article_body: Bengaluru reported 283 new COVID-19 infections on Thursday, up from 261 seen a day before, taking the cumulative total to 18,69,524 cases, said BBMP Chief Commissioner. One more patient died of the infection, taking the total death toll to 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,463, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.07%.

357.title: 9, including 3 minors, killed in Lucknow's Dilkusha as wall collapses amid heavy rain
357.article_body: As many as nine people, including three minors, were killed and two others were injured after a wall collapsed amid heavy rain in Lucknow. The incident took place in Dilkusha under Cantt, the state Home Department said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath has announced financial assistance of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the deceased.

358.title: Trader attacked, robbed in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar; 2 arrested
358.article_body: Two people have been arrested for attacking and robbing a 52-year-old trader in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar area on Wednesday. According to police, Harpreet Singh was walking towards his car when four assailants attacked him and robbed him of ₹34,500 in cash, along with his mobile phone and some cards. Police recovered robbed amount worth ₹16,500 from the accused's possession.

359.title: Burglar wanted in 20 cases held in Navi Mumbai; ₹28 lakh-gold recovered
359.article_body: Gold worth ₹28 lakh was recovered after a burglar who was wanted in 20 house break-in cases was arrested in Navi Mumbai, CP Bipin Kumar Singh said. The accused was traced after the weight of the gold he stole constantly caused his pants to slip off, which forced him to hire an auto from a stand that had CCTV.

360.title: Fire breaks out at chemical research centre in Hyderabad
360.article_body: A fire broke out at a chemical research centre in Hyderabad's Nacharam on Thursday. About 300 litres of chemicals were said to have been burnt in the incident, however, no casualties were reported. Three fire engines were deployed to contain the blaze. This comes days after a fire at an e-bike showroom in the city claimed eight lives.

361.title: Not inviting Russia to Queen Elizabeth II's funeral blasphemous: Moscow
361.article_body: Russia has described the UK's decision not to invite its representatives to Queen Elizabeth II's funeral as "blasphemous". "We see this British attempt to use the national tragedy...for geopolitical purposes to settle scores with our country...as deeply immoral," Russia's Foreign Ministry said. Relations between the two countries have been at a breaking point since Moscow began invading Ukraine.

362.title: Queen's relative faints as her coffin arrives in Westminster Hall; pic surfaces
362.article_body: UK Queen Elizabeth II's relative Lady Gabriella Windsor collapsed as the Queen's coffin arrived at the Westminster Hall for service. Lady Gabriella Windsor was seen being assisted to a seat by several people present at the service. Earlier, a Royal guard fainted and fell off the podium where he was protecting the Queen's coffin.

363.title: Building's wall falls on tin shed in Pimpri Chinchwad; 2 dead
363.article_body: Two people have died after a portion of a building's wall fell on the adjacent tin shed, in which they both were, during plastering work on Thursday in Pimpri Chinchwad's Moshi. A senior inspector said that two labourers who had climbed a bamboo structure for the plastering work were also injured during the incident when the structure collapsed.

364.title: NTA announces Common University Entrance Test-UG 2022 results
364.article_body: National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced the results of the first Common University Entrance Test-Undergraduate (CUET-UG) 2022. Students can check their scorecards at cuet.samarth.ac.in. NTA conducted CUET-UG 2022 in six phases in July-August at 489 centres in 259 cities across India. CUET is conducted for admission to undergraduate courses at central and other participating universities.

365.title: $30 billion wiped off Adobe's market value after $20 billion deal to buy Figma
365.article_body: Shares of Adobe plunged nearly 17% after the Photoshop maker announced a $20 billion cash and stock deal to buy online design startup Figma on Thursday. The biggest plunge in the company's stock since 2010 wiped out more than $30 billion from Adobe's market value. The deal has sparked some concerns among investors who argued that Adobe overpaid for Figma.

366.title: Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend auctions their college photos, gifts for over ₹1.3 crore
366.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend Jennifer Gwynne has raised over $165,000 (₹1.3 crore) from the auction of photos and memorabilia gifted to her by Musk during their year-long relationship in 1994-95. A gold necklace with a green emerald that Musk gave to Gwynne as a birthday present sold for $51,000, whereas Musk's previously unseen photographs sold for up to $21,000.

367.title: Putin laughs as Pak PM struggles with headphones during meeting; video surfaces
367.article_body: A video showing Russian President Vladimir Putin laughing as Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif struggles with headphones during bilateral talks has surfaced on social media. The video, which was shared by former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's party PTI, also showed Sharif asking an aide for help. Putin laughed as the device fell off Sharif's ear.

368.title: Parts of Bengaluru's Nalapad Academy demolished over encroachment
368.article_body: Days after the city witnessed massive flooding, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Wednesday demolished parts of Nalapad Academy, an international school near Embassy Golf Links Business Park. The school, owned by Congress MLA NA Haris, faced allegations of encroachment. Officials said that storm water drain passes through a part of the property.

369.title: Delhi AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan summoned by anti-corruption branch
369.article_body: The anti-corruption branch (ACB) issued a notice to Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Amanatullah Khan over allegations of illegal appointment in the Delhi Waqf Board. The Okhla MLA was called for questioning on Friday afternoon in connection with the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 case registered in 2020. ACB is probing alleged irregularities in recruitment in the Delhi Waqf board.

370.title: BMC to conduct sero-survey in Mumbai from Sept 15 to Oct 6
370.article_body: The BMC will conduct a sero-survey in Mumbai from September 15 to October 6, in order to check COVID-19 antibodies among healthcare and frontline workers. The civic body aims to collect 3,094 samples from 93 places and people, including hospitals, solid waste department and BEST employees. "It'll...help...understand the significance of the third dose of COVID-19 vaccine," an official said.

371.title: Croma Early Bird Sale offers daily deals on all electronics
371.article_body: Croma welcomes the festive season 2022 with its Early Bird Sale from 14th to 18th September. New deals are offered on Croma website and store every day on iPhones, Android smartphones, smartwatches, televisions & other electronics, for a limited period only. HDFC credit card users can avail up to 10% instant discount* and EasyEMI*.

372.title: Passenger with ₹88 lakh foreign currency in laptop bag held at Delhi airport
372.article_body: Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) officials nabbed a passenger carrying foreign currency worth approximately ₹88 lakh at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. The passenger had concealed the currency under a false layer in a 'laptop bag', CISF said while posting a video of the operation. The passenger was later handed over to customs officials.

373.title: 38-year-old ambulance driver shot dead in Delhi
373.article_body: A 38-year-old man, who worked as an ambulance driver, was shot dead on Thursday morning in South West Delhi, police said. Sunil was returning home from work on a motorcycle when two unidentified people, who were also riding a motorcycle, allegedly shot him. The murder was reported in Jaffarpur Kalan area on a road connecting Samaspur Khalsa and Kazipur villages.

374.title: BMTC planning to induct 10 double-decker AC electric buses
374.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) is planning to induct 10 double-decker air-conditioned electric buses, said BMTC Director AV Surya Sen. "Of the 10, amount (for procurement) has been sanctioned for five. We are also in the process of identifying the routes," Sen added. The electric buses are likely to be operated on Outer Ring Road and other peripheral roads.

375.title: Australia's Rachael Haynes, who won 6 World Cups, retires from international cricket
375.article_body: Australia Women batter Rachael Haynes has announced her retirement from international cricket at the age of 35. She played six Tests, 77 ODIs and 84 T20Is in her career. She was part of Australia Women's 2010, 2012, 2018 and 2020 T20 World Cup-winning squads. She also won two ODI World Cups (2013 and 2022).

376.title: Your tennis became a habit and habits never retire: Sachin Tendulkar to Roger Federer
376.article_body: Penning a note on Roger Federer's retirement, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "What a career, @rogerfederer. We fell in love with your brand of tennis." He added, "Slowly, your tennis became a habit. And habits never retire, they become a part of us." Sachin further wrote, "Thank you for all the wonderful memories." Federer won 20 Grand Slams during his career.

377.title: Dalit sisters were raped, strangulated in Lakhimpur Kheri: Autopsy report
377.article_body: The post-mortem report of the two Dalit girls who were found hanging from a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri has confirmed that they were raped and murdered, police said. The report stated that the minor girls died due to strangulation. Police said that the accused hanged the victims to eliminate evidence of murder. Police have arrested six accused.

378.title: I wish this day would have never come: Rafael Nadal on Roger Federer's retirement
378.article_body: Reacting to Roger Federer announcing his retirement, Rafael Nadal tweeted, "Dear Roger, my friend and rival. I wish this day would have never come." He added, "It's a sad day for me personally and for sports around the world." He further wrote, "It's been a pleasure but also an honour and privilege to share all these years with you."

379.title: Chief selector's cheap selection: Mohammad Amir on Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
379.article_body: Pakistani pacer Mohammad Amir took to Twitter to react to Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 that was announced today. "Chief selector ki cheap selection (Chief selector's cheap selection)," he wrote. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "You just sit and watch...Champions Trophy highlights." Amir announced his retirement from international cricket in December 2020 due to then PCB management.

380.title: 'Everybody fixing their bodies, nobody fixing their souls,' writes Deepika in new post
380.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone on Wednesday shared a post featuring pictures from Mijwan 2022, where she walked the ramp. Sharing the post, she wrote in the caption, "It's the last one for me." The last part of the post read, "Everybody is fixing their bodies, nobody fixing their souls." Reacting to this, an Instagram user commented, "Last slide is so true!"

381.title: Will give ED list of 100 TMC leaders with disproportionate assets: BJP MLA
381.article_body: BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari on Thursday stated that he would soon submit documents to the ED that contain details about "disproportionate assets" of 100 Trinamool Congress (TMC) leaders. "A few days back, [West Bengal] CM Mamata Banerjee...claimed that 99% of party workers are honest. But, I've documents to prove [that] nearly 99% of TMC leaders are corrupt," Adhikari claimed.

382.title: Wife, lover electrocutes 26-year-old man to death in Maha; arrested
382.article_body: A 21-year-old woman, her lover and one more person have been arrested in connection with the murder of a 26-year-old lawyer in Maharashtra's Jalna, police said. Kiran Lokhande was killed after his wife and her lover allegedly gave him sleeping pills before electrocuting him. The accused had claimed that Kiran was killed in a blaze caused by gas leakage.

383.title: 16 TDP legislators suspended from Andhra Pradesh Assembly
383.article_body: Sixteen legislators of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) were suspended for a day in the Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly on Thursday for protesting in the Well of the House. The TDP members had allegedly taken offence to purported remarks made by Social Welfare Minister M Nagarjuna on Dalit MLA DBV Swamy. Minister Nagarjuna maintained he had said nothing wrong.

384.title: Speaking Hindi gives me shivers, I speak it with hesitation: FM
384.article_body: At an event organised by Hindi Vivek magazine on Thursday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Addressing an audience in Hindi gives me shivers...I speak Hindi with...'sankoch' (hesitation)." She added that she attended college in Tamil Nadu amid an agitation against Hindi. Students opting for Hindi as the second language did not get scholarships by the state government then, she claimed.

385.title: Astronomers find evidence of Neptune or Saturn-like 'baby' planet in making
385.article_body: Astronomers believe planets are born in protoplanetary disks. Using a new technique, they have found evidence of a baby planet in the making in one such protoplanetary disk known as LkCa 15, located 518 light years away from Earth. The baby planet is roughly the size of Neptune or Saturn and around one to three million years old, astronomers stated.

386.title: China's Xi and Russia's Putin meet in Uzbekistan, discuss ties
386.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russia’s Vladimir Putin discussed enhancing bilateral ties on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Uzbekistan on Thursday. Putin launched a veiled criticism of the US, saying “attempts to create a unipolar world" have taken an "ugly shape". Xi said Russia and China will play a leading role in a "rapidly changing world".

387.title: AI startup Rephrase.ai raises $10.6 mn in Series A funding round
387.article_body: Artificial Intelligence startup Rephrase.ai, backed by Lightspeed Ventures, has raised $10.6 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Red Ventures and saw participation from Silver Lake and 8VC Ventures, among other investors. Founded in 2019 by IIT alumni Ashray Malhotra, Nisheeth Lahoti and Shivam Mangla, the startup is a synthetic media production platform.

388.title: US singer R Kelly convicted of child pornography charge
388.article_body: US singer R Kelly has been convicted of child pornography by a jury in Chicago. Of the 13 counts on trial, Kelly was found guilty on six counts. A count of child pornography carries a minimum sentence of five years in Chicago. Kelly is already serving a 30-year prison sentence after conviction in racketeering and sex trafficking charges.

389.title: IIT alumni's US-based startup raises $90 mn in funding round
389.article_body: Fortanix Inc, a US-based data security startup founded by IIT graduates, has raised $90 million in its Series C funding round led by Goldman Sachs Group Inc fund. The round also saw participation from Giantleap Capital and existing investors such as Intel Capital. The startup was founded in 2016 by IIT Kanpur alumni Ambuj Kumar and Anand Kashyap.

390.title: Indian-American Shefali Duggal appointed US' Ambassador to the Netherlands
390.article_body: Indian-American political activist Shefali Razdan Duggal has been appointed the US' next Ambassador to the Netherlands. Duggal's nomination was confirmed by the US Senate in a voice vote. Duggal, 50, is a Kashmiri Pandit. She was born in Haridwar and shifted to Pennsylvania, US, with her family when she was two years old.

391.title: UK to observe 2-min national silence during Queen's state funeral
391.article_body: The UK will observe two-minute national silence during Queen Elizabeth II’s state funeral on Monday, the Buckingham Palace said. Releasing details of the funeral arrangements, the palace said Elizabeth’s coffin will be taken from Westminster Abbey to Wellington Arch on a horse-drawn gun carriage. The funeral will be attended by around 2,000 guests, including people the Queen had honoured.

392.title: NASA's supernova remnant image gives clues about its star’s death
392.article_body: Astronomers studying the remains of a supernova captured using NASA telescopes have found clues about the star's death. The supernova remnant called SNR 0519-69.0 is the debris from an explosion of a white dwarf star, which according to NASA's Chandra Ray Observatory, underwent a thermonuclear explosion after reaching critical mass. It's located in a small galaxy called Large Magellanic Cloud.

393.title: Ex-President of WBBSE Kalyanmoy Ganguly arrested in SSC scam case
393.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Thursday arrested Kalyanmoy Ganguly, former President of West Bengal Board of Secondary Education (WBBSE), in connection with the state SSC recruitment scam case. Ganguly was arrested after being questioned by CBI officials. Earlier in the day, the CBI raided the offices of two software companies in connection with the case.

394.title: Gems, jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August to ₹26,418 crore
394.article_body: The overall gems and jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August 2022 to ₹26,418.84 crore as compared to ₹24,749.69 crore in the same period last year, the Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) said on Thursday. However, the overall gross export of cut and polished diamonds (CPD) declined 0.84% to ₹14,955.8 crore in August.

395.title: BJP paid ₹40-50 cr to each of 8 Goa Cong MLAs: AICC Goa in-charge
395.article_body: After eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP, AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Thursday accused the BJP of paying ₹40-50 crore to each legislator. "The national party (BJP) is doing such things everywhere. Where is all this money coming from?" Gundu Rao questioned. "They are misusing the power. They are breaking the elected representatives," Rao said.

396.title: Nigeria’s consumer inflation hit 17-year high in August 2022
396.article_body: The Nigerian National Bureau of Statistics on Thursday said the country's consumer inflation rose to its highest level in 17 years in August 2022. As per official data, inflation rose to 20.5% in August, up from 19.6% in July this year. This is the seventh straight month wherein Nigeria has recorded an increase in its inflation rate.

397.title: Thief dangles from train window for 10 km in Bihar as passengers grab his arms
397.article_body: A man trying to snatch a mobile phone from a train passenger through the window was left hanging outside for 10 km, apologising, as passengers grabbed his arms. The video is from Bihar and the train was reportedly nearing the end of its journey from Begusarai to Khagaria. The passengers let him go when the train was close to Khagaria.

398.title: BJP 'gifts' 5 autos to Kejriwal after his run-in with Guj police
398.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs reached Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence to offer him a 'gift' of 5 autorickshaws after his argument with Gujarat police over being stopped from getting in the three-wheeler. In Gujarat, Kejriwal had an argument with policemen in his security detail about getting into an auto owing to security concerns. Kejriwal was going to the auto driver's home.

399.title: What was gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's 'Plan B' to kill Salman Khan?
399.article_body: Members of the Goldie Brar-Lawrence Bishnoi gang had rented a room in Panvel to recce Salman Khan's farmhouse. The gangsters managed to track down the route and judging by the potholes, they surmised that the actor's car could be travelling at around 25 kmph. Bishnoi's men also befriended the security guards at the farmhouse by pretending to be his fans.

400.title: World number one Alcaraz reacts to Federer's retirement with broken heart emoji
400.article_body: World number one men's tennis player Carlos Alcaraz, who recently stated he'd like to face Roger Federer, reacted to Federer's retirement with a broken heart emoji. He tweeted, "Roger...[broken heart emoji]." In another tweet, he wrote, "Roger has been one of my idols...Thank you for everything you have done for our sport...I still want to play with you!"
